newsitem.title: CHINA: China to encourage foreign funds in coal sector.
newsitem.headline: China to encourage foreign funds in coal sector.

text.p: China will open up 300 large coal projects to overseas investors to try to encourage more foreign investment in its coal industry the Xinhua news agency said on Thursday.
The Ministry of Coal Industry would give priority to foreign investment in pit-head power plants, coal transport facilities and tapping coal-bed methane, Xinhua said.
The ministry would also try to develop clean coal technology, the agency said.
China would turn out 1.29 billion tonnes of coal in 1996 and was aiming to boost annual ouput to 1.45 billion tonnes by 2000, it said.
Beijing has approved a proposal calling for investment totalling 145 billion yuan ($17.5 billion) in the coal industry between 1996 and 2000.
China has more than 600 state-run coal mines, 1,600 run by local governments and 80,000 community-run mines.
China earlier this year said it would open up at least 200 coal projects to foreign investors. It did not specify whether foreign investors would be allowed to export output.
